doc.previous: In 2007 and 2008 the company increased its overseas expansion efforts. On 25 October 2007, HBC officially opened a new aerospace manufacturing facility in Chihuahua, Mexico and on 26 March 2010 appointed Hawker Pacific Singapore as its first Hawker 4000 authorized service center in Southeast Asia.[21][22]
after: In response to the late-2000s recession the company announced the lay-off of 490 employees at its Wichita facility in January 2009.[23]

On 3 February 2009, CEO Jim Schuster announced that a further 2,300 employees would be laid off before the end of the year. The company indicated that orders for aircraft had slowed down, especially by fractional jet operators. Schuster said:[24]
